title: Citi Hungary Launches 2012-2013 Corvinus University-Citibank Education Program
summary: Budapest, Hungary - Citi Hungary and the Corvinus University launched the 2012-2013 Corvinus University-Citibank Education Program on October 18 at the Corvinus Campus in Budapest. Students from Corvinus University's Enterprise Finances Department will participate in the program, which aims to enhance students' career prospects through interaction with Citi volunteers and participation in seminars.
tag-1: Citi Hungary Launches 2012-2013 Corvinus University-Citibank Education Program
tag-2: Budapest, Hungary – Citi Hungary and the Corvinus University launched the 2012-2013 Corvinus University–Citibank Education Program on October 18 at the Corvinus Campus in Budapest. Students from Corvinus University's Enterprise Finances Department will participate in the program, which aims to enhance students' career prospects through interaction with Citi volunteers and participation in seminars.
tag-3: The program is financially supported by the Citi Foundation and is in its ninth year. Since its launch in 2004, a total of 1,320 students have participated in the program, which include a series of lectures by Citibank volunteers who are experts in various financial and banking topics related to the university's curriculum, a Case Study Competition and the Best Graduating Student Awards.
tag-4: At the program launch, Batara Sianturi, CCO for Hungary, held an interactive session with the students and delivered a presentation, "Global Banking Update." He also presented this year's Citi Best Graduating Student Awards, together with Dr. Miklos Virag, Head of the Department of Enterprise Finances, and Dr. Attila Fiath, professor at Corvinus University. Klaudia Szijjarto and Peter Pongracz were selected as joint winners based on displaying outstanding proactive attitudes throughout their studies in addition to achieving exceptional final grades for the 2011/2012 academic year.
tag-5: Peter Pongracz said: "I am very happy to receive this award. The guest lectures by Citibank experts over the past two years were very interesting and useful as they complemented our theoretical knowledge with their real business experiences. The structured thinking, entrepreneurial and teamwork skills that I developed through my studies and various group projects helped me to secure a job before graduation. This is a skill set that I use and continue to build on every day in my work. My long-term plans include launching my own enterprise and the prize money from the Best Graduating Student Award will be a great help in the startup phase."
tag-6: Attila Fiath, professor at the Enterprise Finances Department and program manager at the university, said, "I am pleased that we have the opportunity to continue this partnership with Citibank that builds on the success of previous years. As a professor, I believe that the Citibank lectures, as well as the Case Study Competition and the Best Graduating Student Awards, encourage and motivate students to enhance their professional, analytical and practical knowledge and skills beyond the curriculum."
tag-7: Batara Sianturi said: "This was my third year launching the program and presenting the interactive session with students. I am very pleased to see how interested students are in the knowledge and experience that we as seniors of a global financial institution can share with them. We are proud to contribute to the enhancement of education at the university as this is one of our key focus areas in Citi's global and our local philanthropic strategy."
